intro: Deinacanthon, commonly known as the narrow-leafed spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Deinacanthon is native to regions of Africa and is often found in dry, open habitats. It is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
